review: Great experience and filly satisfied with the consultation.The Doctor is very much experienced and is very friendly

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I took my child to Dr. Nancy at 9:30pm, one night,  for stomach ache and chills with fever. She had diagnosed the problem very well and gave the ***** medicines. She had suggested a few tests to be taken immediately next morning. By 7:30am in the morning she had called me up to check how the child was doing and if I found a diagnostic centre to do the tests. Until my child was alright, she followed up. I have not come across a doctor like Dr. Nancy who listens to the problem patiently, so empathetic and makes sure the patient is completely recovered with minimal medicines. Thank you so much doctor for being there for us at that odd hour.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
It's been more than 6 months that we are consulting Dr Nancy for vaccinations and regular health check up for my daughter. It's been a really great experience till now . she advises the correct process * ***** *********** ********** * Her new clinic near basavanpur is helpful to near by parents who depends travelling longer distances .

Her vast experience in this industry is real plus point also helpfull to parents in aviod panic and ensure her guidance even through phone and what's app .
reply_text: Thank you

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
My Son age 8 years was severely sick and coughing for 2 days, so we thought to visit a doctor and used the Practo app, booked an appointment with Dr. Nancy. It was late but when I called Dr. Nancy, she without any hesitation and treated my son with utmost care, it was almost 10 PM and Dr. Nancy reluctantly took care of my son treating him for 2 hours. Her compassionate and dedication to her profession is commendable. My son healed immediately and I will definitely suggest all to consult with her for quick and prompt remedy especially for kids. 
*** ***** ** *** *****

tags: None
review:
Doctor is anyway good but prescribed high dose anti biotic, which our kid cud not absorb. Prescribed us for doing MRI, ***** *** ******* ** ** *****
With gods grace, everything is all ri8 now, we just stopped the prescribed medicine and cure followed with some basic Homeo path
reply_text: As per antibiotic prescribing guide lines antibiotic was prescribed as per weight of the child and no high dose was given . The child presented with head ache , vomiting and wet cough of about 2 weeks duration There  was no fever . The next day you had called up saying the child is vomiting more , feeling giddy , more sleepy and not getting out of bed. Then I had given a referral letter to a tertiary children’s hospital mentioning in the referral letter that the child needs examination and investigation to rule out any ICSOL ( intra cranial space occupying lesion / tumour ) . I have not prescribed any MRI . It was in the interest of the child with such complaints that a tumour is ruled out at the earliest . I have only done that and you have given a negative review which is misleading and is an avoidable cast aspersion of the doctor.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: We had online consulted Dr. Nancy for our 2.5 yr kid who was suffering from fever since few days. The doctor swiftly diagnosed the reason and suitably prescribed medications.  She is extremely clear in communication and patiently explained us everything. She also proactively follow-ups and checks well being of her patients under consultation.  We are very much satisfied with her consultation and her friendliness towards kids.
reply_text: Thank you very much. Your child’s well-being is as much my happiness as that of the parents.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,Value for money,

My daughter was suffering with sneezing and doctor Nancy’s medicines start giving results with in 5 days. I am very happy with the treatment and will refer to others as well

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: I am a first time mother facing with milk supply shortages and supplementing  with formula milk for my baby, but Dr was continuously talking about the bad side of formula milk. Yes, as a mother I am also not interested in giving formula for my baby.After consultation I am really tensed as if she was not friendly in explaining things, also said my baby is overweight due to formula. As new mom we go through many difficulties from low supply to post partum depressions. Please consider a mother’s feelings and explain things friendly.
reply_text: I am sorry if you felt my talk was not friendly . I have tried to explain to you the importance of only giving breast milk to your baby till 6 months of age because of the many benefits for your baby now and in years to come . The more formula milk you give the less your breast milk supply will become . It is only sucking at the breast which will produce milk . I have also tried to explain to you that your baby’s weight is on the higher side and so the baby was getting adequate milk and there was no need for supplementing with formula . I had tried to explain to you what is best for your baby from the scientific point of view . If you found me stressing on these points not to your liking I am sorry for the same .

“Thank you ma’am for doing more than the minimum required; you always do so much more than that for your patients. “

“Thank you, all I can say is “thank you. “
I wish I don’t fall sick or ill but at the same time I would like to meet you again and again.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Visited her vaccination and the doctor was not friendly at all and wouldnt even touch the child and was in a hurry for payment and her husband was telling her that it was getting late and patients are waiting outside... no clear answer given for some of the questions asked.
reply_text: I regret to hear about the unfortunate experience. In all vaccination cases besides going in to the birth history , baby’s growth and development is assessed and I personally administer the vaccine in each case. Furthermore, I am a retired senior doctor who served the Government of India, money is a subservient entity in my practice. It is not understood how I can administer the vaccine with out touching the baby. On checking  the records in this particular case it was seen that all these details have been recorded and some investigation were advised based on the nature of presenting complaints. The baby was seen on 19 th Jan and the feed back was given on 19 th March at 3 am. It’s also unfortunate that Practo doesn’t have a transparent mechanism to verify the veracity of such claims.
